alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fremont County through 415 PM MDT... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Howard, or 10 miles north of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Rock slides and ponding of water could occur on highway 50 during the heavier rain. Locations impacted include... Coaldale and Howard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft
